含义: The character '设' primarily means 'to set up', 'to establish', 'to design', or 'to arrange'. It conveys the idea of creating or organizing something in a structured manner.
字形: '设' is composed of two parts: the left radical '讠' (speech) and the right component '殳' (a weapon). The combination suggests the idea of planning or strategizing, possibly through verbal commands or strategic arrangements.
读音: The pronunciation of '设' is 'shè' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '设' originates from ancient Chinese, where it was used to denote the act of setting up or arranging. The radical '讠' indicates its relation to speech or communication, while '殳' suggests a methodical or strategic approach.
成语: 设身处地 (shè shēn chǔ dì) - put oneself in someone else's shoes
设心积虑 (shè xīn jī lǜ) - scheme with all one's might
例句: 他设计了一个新的应用程序。 (He designed a new application.)
我们需要设定明确的目标。 (We need to set clear goals.)
短故事: 在古代，一位将军设下计策，成功地击败了敌人。 (In ancient times, a general set up a strategy and successfully defeated the enemy.)
设计师设想了未来的城市，充满了绿色和科技。 (The designer envisioned a future city full of greenery and technology.)
诗词: 设使天下无孤，不知几人称帝，几人称王。 (If there were no solitary figures in the world, who knows how many would declare themselves emperors or kings.) - From 'Romance of the Three Kingdoms'
设身处地，方知他人苦。 (Only by putting oneself in another's place can one understand their suffering.) - Traditional Proverb
